ua.sumdu.j2se.kryshtop.tasks

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • ua.sumdu.j2se.kryshtop.tasks.Task

  • public class Task
extends java.lang.Object
    This class describes task.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kryshtop Andrii

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Task(java.lang.String title, int time)
      To initialize an inactive task that is performed at the set time, without repeating and with the established name.
      Task(java.lang.String title, int start, int end, int interval)
      To initialize an inactive task that is performed in set distance of time, with the established interval and established title.

        time - a time when the task performed

      • Task

        public Task(java.lang.String title,
            int start,
            int end,
            int interval)
        To initialize an inactive task that is performed in set distance of time, with the established interval and established title.
        Parameters:
        title - title of the task
        start - start of the distance
        end - end of the distance
        interval - interval of task performance

      • getTime

        public int getTime()
        To get time of performance for tasks, that do not repeat.
        Returns:
        time of performance (if task repeats - return start time of repetition)

      • setTime

        public void setTime(int time)
        To set time for not repeatable tasks. If task is repeatable - will make it not repeatable.
        Parameters:
        time - time of performance

      • getStartTime

        public int getStartTime()
        To get start time.
        Returns:
        start time (if task is not repeatable - return time of performance)

      • getEndTime

        public int getEndTime()
        To get end time.
        Returns:
        end time (if task is not repeatable - return time of performance)

      • getRepeatInterval

        public int getRepeatInterval()
        To get repeat interval.
        Returns:
        interval (if task is not repeatable - return 0)

      • setTime

        public void setTime(int start,
                    int end,
                    int interval)
        To set time for repeatable tasks. If task is not repeatable - will make it repeatable.
        Parameters:
        start - start time
        end - start time
        interval - repeat interval

      • isRepeated

        public boolean isRepeated()

      • nextTimeAfter

        public int nextTimeAfter(int current)
        To get next time of task performance after established time.
        Parameters:
        current - current time
        Returns:
        nest time of task performance (if task is not performed after established time - return -1)
